Column Comment.0: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of any object thatoccupies an area, such as a land right, field, facility or area of interest. The surfacedescription may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes and bounds orpolygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals (substances) andsubsurface definition (zones/formations) that are included in the definition. For landrights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatial description.
Column Comment.1: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.2: MINERAL ZONE ID: unique identifier for the mineral zone
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: BASE QUALIFIER: qualifier, such as top or base, that describes the part of the zonedefinition that is to be used. Allows you to state whether the top or the base of thezone definition is used for the BASE ZONE DEFINITION ID. e.g the base of the zoneis defined by the base of this zone definition.
Column Comment.5: ZONE DEFINITION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a mineral zone definition that iscreated and maintained by a regulatory or other agency as one of a set of standards.May also be an ad hoc definition for the land zone that is created by an owner oradministrator. In the case where the same zone definition is used for both the top andbase of the definition of the granted rights, populate the same value for both the TOPand BASE ZONE DEFINITION ID columns.
Column Comment.6: DEEP RIGHTS REVERSION INDICATOR: a yes / no flag that indicates that thiszone definition is for deeper rights reversion designation (for the Crown of Alberta)
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.9: INACTIVATION DATE: Date on which the Mineral Zone was actually inactivated. Notthe same as expiry date, which is the date on which the primary term of theagreement ends.
Column Comment.10: METES AND BOUNDS: a textual description of the mineral zone definition which isgranted through the agreement. May include a description of the formation, zone,depth or the areal extent for which this zone is valid.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.14: TOP QUALIFIER: qualifier, such as top or base, that describes the part of the zonedefinition that is to be used. Allows you to state whether the top or the base of thezone definition is used for the TOP ZONE DEFINITION ID.
Column Comment.15: ZONE DEFINITION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a mineral zone definition that iscreated and maintained by a regulatory or other agency as one of a set of standards.May also be an ad hoc definition for the land zone that is createdby an owner oradministrator. In the case where the same zone definition is used for both the top andbase of the definition of the granted rights, populate the same value for both the TOPand BASE ZONE DEFINITION ID columns.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
